files.name: qti.xml
files.content:
Directions:

  • You will work on your own to organize your data, use your results to draw conclusions, and explore other data that is presented. You may use the Word Bank below during this session.
  • Answer questions as completely as you can.

Word Bank

Average (mean) to get the average, add all of the numbers together and divide the total by the number of figures in the set
Concentration the amount of a solute per unit volume of a solvent
Carbon Dioxide

(CO2)

 a gas that is given off during combustion and breathing
Ingredient a substace that is part of a mixture; in cooking, recipes identify which ingredientsare needed to prepare something
Multiple trials when an experiment is repeated several times
Oxygen a gas in the air that is used by living things

Analyzing and Using Your Results

Directions: Use data from your investigation to answer questions 1 through 3.

  1. Explain why it was important in this investigation to measure the mass of the substances and bags before and after you mixed the substances. Use speciﬁc evidence to support your answer.

  1. Look at your prediction from Part 1 of this experiment. Do the results of your investigation support your prediction? Use speciﬁc information from the investigation to explain your answer.

  1. Do you think the investigation was a controlled investigation? Use speciﬁc data and examples to support your answer.

title: Mass and Matter Experiment - Part 3 - Analyzing and Using Results
